page.title: 01Honington
page.content: Honington is a small village lying North-West of Bury St. Edmunds in Suffolk. The A 1088, linking Stowmarket with Thetford, runs through the village. A difficult corner where a barn projects into the road has caused some traffic problems, and recently a 40mph limit. Villagers would prefer the route not to be signed from the A 45, sending major route traffic on a safer route via Bury. The village lies in the valley of the Black Bourn, a small river which runs North to join the Little Ouse, but in the village served a water mill, now derelict. It is historically a farming community, but now serves more often as a dormitory village for workers in Bury and surrounding districts, as well as some personnel for the RAF Station.
